page.title: 14LANGUAGE BEULAH - GARTH
page.content: Serious decline in Welsh speaking, which had begun before the advent of many new English residents. Welsh is taught in schools - a peripatetic teacher serving primary schools in the Builth district, including Irfon Valley School. Hardly any fluent Welsh speakers, even amongst middle-aged people - probably no more than a dozen older folk. Welsh influence still stronger in Beulah than Garth, it decreases as one gets nearer Builth. Almost all houses in Beulah have Welsh names, fewer in Garth. Powys County Council road signs are in English only. No families of foreign extraction, speaking other languages in the home.
